place_description: Lively indoor market hosting local shops, bars, bakeries & a variety of counter-serve eateries.

reviews_data.review_text: Great market. Super food options as well as drink options. A couple merchandise stores. Good amount of seating. Didn't feel crowded. Comparable pricing, not over done.
Really good food!!!!
Tried the pizza place it was good
We ordered pasta, the grandma pizza, grilled cheese, vegan wine, and African grilled chicken wrap. We had to try almost everything and most definitely recommend!

The cheese shop is super helpful and has speciality nights. They offer a good grilled cheese for kids with the most discerning of tastes. (AKA "picky" lol).

The wine shop is knowledgeable and great at recommending new things to try.

There are many yummy options of various cuisines around the world. You can get snacks, arepas, roti, popcorn, coffees, and Indian food (vegetarian options available).

There is both indoor and outdoor seating, and it's a great place to spend time while waiting for the train.
Adorable market in the heart of uptown. Places to eat, shop, make candles, more.
Somewhat run down and dirty
Excellent
Just came here for a beer while waiting for the train but definitely plan to come back and eat / hang out. A lot of different food options.
Vera pasta italiana ,se sei a charlotte e vuoi sentirti a casa mangia un piatto di pasta qui e sara un emozione unica

Very disappointed when we arrived because all the vendors were not even open. Some of the vendors that were there were not even friendly. Definitely will not be back. Waste of time! (Parking accords the street is $20.....not worth it!)

Went to Charlotte, NC to see our friend's Walden University's commencement ceremony for her PhD at the Convention Center. We took the Charlotte Ward tour (name?) that picked us up at the Market at 7th Street. Then we stayed and had a bite there while we waited for the Charlotte/New Orleans basketball game. This place is a gem!  Geno D's Pizza place was great; a bit pricey but WELL worth it. I highly recommend this area, if are near downtown!
Enjoyed the dumplings and waffle I usually get. Now, found a bakery w/delicious cookies! La Bonbonierre

The market is amazing.  Lots to choose from, including wine and cheese shops,  pizza,  noodles,  desserts, etc. Momo has a rude owner. Does not treat you like he wants return customers. The pizza shop was really busy and the food looked tasty.

Interesting spot to visit.  Good selection of food options.  Traditional, ethnic, snacks and dessert.  Also a good wine bar.

Sometimes, it gets busy and the service drops, though.
Really unique venue with multiple cuisine options.
Fun place to come and grab something to eat!
What a fantastic experience! Something for everyone.
Small public market, but has several food choices. The cheese place has awesome paninis and a very friendly staff.
Definitely not much to see. I was in and out.

When i said a good time was had. That is exactly what i mean. Sit beside people you may or may not know. That's okay the atmosphere social. There is something for everyone. No one gets left behind. If you haven't get there in a hurry.
Love going here.

Wonderful place to visit for food, drinks and shopping. An unexpected gem in Uptown Charlotte that reminded us a lot of Quincy Market in.Boston. Pizza, cannolis and beer were off the chart. This will definitely be a regularly visited place moving forward.
The star I have put up mama always say if u don't have nothing nice to say be quit star's speak for it self
Love coming here for a quick bite and a quick drink.
Bom
The variety of vendors and food stalls makes this one of Charlotte's crown jewels.
We were here for private event for VA Tech tailgate party. The BBQ and Mac and cheese were delicious. Bartenders were great also. The place was decorated nice and love corn hole downstairs
Nice interesting stores
Awesome blend of numerous restaurants and shops! You can find something here for everyone! From Italian, to Asian, to American, to African.
Great little market with nice variety of items
Stoped in for a light late lunch and beverages before we hopped onto funny bus. Great spot, will visit again

It was nice, a little small compared to some others I've been to.  The cheese shop has some great finds, and they are very knowledgeable if you want a great cheese and meat board.  Oh, and lots great honey's.

I saw this place advertised online and the reviews and pictures made us want to give it a try while we were in Carolina. We had to park across the street from the market and the price was absurd for one hour. Once we walked in we couldn't even tell if the place was open for business or going out of business. I got pizza and my wife got cannolis both were heavily overpriced and the portions were very small. The pizza was so salty I couldn't even finish the tiny pizza I had ordered. I will never go here again nor would I recommend this place to anyone. Between the parking the food and drinks with our meal I spent almost $90 and we left in 30 minutes very disappointed.
The cannoli @ Mano bella . Can't wait to go back.
100% good vibes all day everyday!
The food at Serengeti Kitchen was delicious .
The market is always  good place to go especially if your not from Charlotte. This place has a variety of options to food, drink and crafts.
The entire food court was really great warm place. We has food at momo station which was Indian.
Food was good but a little pricey!
Its a fun place to be, with good coffee shop (not just coffee) beer place, Pizza, wine shop, candies for kids, momos.
Love the cheese ship and their specialty chocolates!

The Market at 7th Street is a great meeting place. It is perfect for groups when you don't know who is what diet. There's delicious coffee from a local popular place, local beer bar, hand-made pasta, the owner is from Florence, Italy. The best cheese shop in Charlotte, delicious pizza, waffle stall, momos and a small, quirky wine shop. You can park for free for 90 minutes, but then it jumps to insane pricing. I usually find parking around the park across the street.

Rally good place to grab something to eat. Walking by saw the market and stop by to check it out! Surprised with the different options of food and beverage! I got something healthy; a strawberry water cup, it was good! The pizza was also great in another place! I recommend this place if you're close by! Sure I'll visit again. The location is pretty and near a park and a library for kids. Next time I'll try something from a different place in this market!
Cute food court with a variety of options. Most stalls validate parking but the garage doesn't take off the discount and still charges
Good vibe and had food and if you want to have some wine with friends,  is nice.
You

This is always a fun experience. In general the vendors are helpful and kind. Generally very clean space, and sometimes they do fun events.  For Halloween, they had trick or treating for kids, I don't have any but they were cute to watch. The food is always amazing. Occasionally gets a little crowded.
Super chill place. Think of a high class, fancy food court.

My absolutely favorite place to eat in Charlotte!
Hip Hop Smoothies
Geno Ds Pizza
It's Poppin
Just to name a few of their delicious options
Fantabulous place for the whole family to go.
Nice, busy area. Good places to eat at. We had Geno Ds pizza. Nj style pizza and boy did it feel like home. The pizza was great and definitely will go back, with more people too.
It's Like an Outlet Mall, Full of Different Types of Restaurants and Good Vibes..

Nice place, check it out if you're near.
Unfortunately not very busy when I was there.
Susser kleiner Markt mit einigen Essensmoglichkeiten.
Foi gostoso. Meio caro.
Little market nice atmosphere
This is my go-to place to buy cheese, wines, and pasta. In one stop, you can grab an amazing section of items for an awesome meal at home.  Also has coffee  and great local beer.
Fun place with lots of small vendors. Highly recommend coffee and smoothies.

The Market at 7th Street in Charlotte is a cool, busy spot in Uptown where you can find all kinds of food and local goods. It's great for grabbing a bite to eat or picking up something unique. You'll find everything from coffee and sandwiches to sushi and Southern food, so there's a little bit of something for everyone.

The atmosphere is casual, with plenty of seating, though it can get crowded, especially on weekends. The vendors are friendly and will help you choose if you're not sure what to get. Parking can be a hassle, but it's easy to get there by light rail.

Overall, it's a fun place to check out if you're in the area and want some good food or just want to hang out.
Love this place! So many delicious options. I go every chance I get.
This is an indoor venue where you can shop for eats and drinks. Seating is open. Nice place to go with a few folks that have different pallets.
It's a cool concept, I hope it continues to grow and have fewer jewelry & miscellaneous vendors in favor of more food variety.
We loved the shrimp tacos at Mad Dash.  Delicious!
We visited on a slower day and time. However, the food options were on full display. The pizza was my wife's favorite. Highly recommended.

I arrived at the Market at 7th Street early, so not every shop was open. I'll have to return just to try the momos! I had an appointment, so I didn't stay long, but it seems a good place to hang out and shop, eat or drink.

My sister and I had stopped over this market to have lunch and rest after a very long flight. Everyone was very polite, the food was good and well served by "Mano bella". I recommend passing by to have a cold beer and chill !

Plenty of yummy food options. On this occasion, we just had a couple of brews at Resident Culture. The light Right Time was flavorful and refreshing. For those NA fans, their N.A.R.C (non-alcoholic Resident Culture) Lime and Sea Salt was the BEST NA I've ever had!
Options are fine, definitely needs a couple more/better options. Not Just Coffee is awesome, and so is the Pizza from Geno D's and the pasta from the place next to it!

I always go here to eat at MAD Dash, get popcorn and fruited water at Its Poppin and smoothies at Hip Hop Smoothies. They never disappoint. It is so many varieties of food to try here that could be slightly overwhelming but worth the visit. I like to sit and people watch while I socialize and even the seating outside is nice.
Convenient uptown, clean, nice atmosphere. Can't forget the good food

What a wonderful surprise. I came into Charlotte by bus out of New York on a very hot morning and happened to walk up on this station.
Very good central air-conditioning, clean atmosphere and a really nice collection of venders along with restroom facilities.
Pizza, pastries, I believe burgers and homemade Italian pasta. Add a cheese vender and large wine bar. How can you go wrong.
While waiting for transportation, I had a wonderful "no rush" opportunity to sample the cuisine.
Cool spot!
First time there.  Food atmosphere vibe .  Excellent!! I'll recommend it to my close friends
Great variety of food vendors. Ate from two during our visit and the food and service was excellent. Highly recommend stopping by!
The food at Mano Bella Artisan Foods was pure perfection. Truly made from scratch. Shout out to Nic he's a phenomenal cook!
Great options and atmosphere
Lots of different food options and places to explore. Perfect lunch spot for those who want various choices for not everyone who has the same taste. Nice variety for all!
Great place with plenty of food choices, especially with a bunch of kids who all want something different to eat!

Never met a food hall that I didn't love, and this one didn't disappoint. Smaller than most, but some great options! The pasta place and the cheese bar were our favs-
The homemade pasta alla crema was spectacular, as was the grilled cheese #1 from the cheese shop. Grab a loaf of fresh bread and some salted French butter to go to enjoy at home later.
Great Food, wine and Smoothies. There is also a place to buy candles and other Charlotte themed items. The best food court in the city!
I had the best homemade  pasta from Mano Bella.

This cozy little market is all on one floor. We got hungry while browsing and ended up at the cheese shop at the far end. Ordered a grilled cheese sandwich there. The staff was super friendly - they even gave us a sample of the cheese before grilling it, explaining a bit about it (can't remember what kind it was, though).

I was blown away by how fresh the cheese tasted raw - totally different from what I expected. Once grilled, it was a whole new experience. The bread was top-notch too. It's amazing how two simple ingredients can come together so perfectly.

Definitely recommend checking this place out if you're in the mood for a killer grilled cheese!
Great food and good fast service
It used to be really nice. Now there are so many homeless people circling the area and in the bathrooms making it unsafe.

It's okay. There weren't any lively vibes. We went in to check it out and it seemed as though no one was working their food areas. There was however a bunch of wine which seemed cool but didn't buy any.
Waste of time. Difficult to know who this aimed at.
OG food hall in Charlotte operating as a non profit to incubate new food businesses. I got food from Ormans Cheese Shop and it was fantastic.
An outstanding place to find something to eat.  Haven't tried all the shops, but looking forward to trying them all.

Cute place with good food but they close at 8pm?? That's so early... we showed up at 7:20ish and almost all the places were already closed for the day. Guess they decided to take the evening off? 8 of us friends met here for dinner and all had to get pasta for dinner because the other options were closed. Would have been nice to try things from different places.
10/10 all around. The individual places to eat and drink here were quite amazing as well. It was a nice chill environment to get some food and relax with friends. Will be going back again!

Really cool food hall. We stopped for a drink, didn't get food, but there looked to be plenty of options. We liked how there were board games to play. We had a few beers and played Scrabble on a Sunday evening. It was nice!
Inside the market, there are many places to try out. The food is ok, but the ambience is great, if you are to have a glass of wine or beer.
Great area in Charlotte to have a variety of food options under one roof. Reminds me of cafeteria days!

Food court of local food and drink spots - a good place for breakfast or lunch, open early. And we've been coming here for casual dinners before performances uptown. Your choice of dinner, plus a great wine shop.
Awesome place that offers great food and drinks.  Pizza is amazing, bar and wine vendors are extremely kind and resourceful with knowledge of the city.
First time there and it was amazing so many people were there having a great time.
Ormans chesse place has the best grilled cheese sandwiches, including gluten free. Order a sandwich then grab a glass of wine at the wine shop that's at the same end. Divine!

Went to the street taco place. I don't eat meat, but they have black beans and I ordered a taco salad bowl . But it wasn't a "BOWL". IT was no dressing for the "salad" and it was beans on the side. Dry dry and dry. It was a very small size. So I'm going to say I donated to them. Didn't eat it.
Just don't park your car at the 7th Street parking deck the prices are outrageous I paid $21 for 2 hours and 9 minutes that is ridiculous
Not much going on, get more in there!
Loved it ! Super cute
Had a fresh cup of Caramel Frappe with a friendly smile at Not Just Coffee .. loved it !
What a unique place! Love it!
Good Food, Good Service...worth the wait.  Very lively atmosphere.  Glad to have visited this place at my stay in Charlotte, NC.
Pizza was great

This was during Charlotte Shout.
My wife and daughter enjoying the adult teeter-totter. It makes this old dad smile.

It's been a while since the last time I was in a market like this. Places like these are pretty hard to find in the US, but today I absolutely loved it!

There's so much food stands and vendors that it's hard for me to choose, but after giving a few of them a chance I came to the conclusion that you just can't mess up with whatever you pick.

Great place in charlotte.  Every stand in this food hall worth visiting.  Geno D's pizza is the best in Charlotte and just one of the best period ...jimmy pearls is awesome seafood ..check it all out. Smoothies ..fruit drink...coffee....beer. All great. Good location....hit it up and enjoy
The food was good, but the place was pretty dirty. The service was a bit slow also.
I went for the pasta. I was not disappointed.
Love this place!
Delicious food.  Interesting food court. I would go again if in Charlotte
Get the jhol momos

This lovely establishment has plenty to offer. We had pizza. Grilled cheese. Pasta carbonara. Cotton Candy. And some other goodies. Parking was challenging since we arrived at about 4 pm on a Saturday. We managed to obtain$15 parking right across the street. Traffic was honestly, Horrible. While dining on our food outside, we were greeted with lots of smiles & hellos. Inside are a few quaint shops with unique items available for purchase.
Very nice and laid back atmosphere . I like the kind of people that go there who are working class and tourists.
I always adore the place for it's vibe and nice vendors.
I got a soda there that was really good they had a lot of different food vendors, but most were closed. I got a soda in the back pretty good
Ample seating and a wide variety of shops and food. Enjoyed my experience here and will be back when in the area.
Food was great but you can have trouble finding seating through out the day, especially on the weekends.
It's an okay food court, nothing special. Prices are high and service generally seemed like they didn't wanna be there to be honest.
Falta mejora En el ambiente
Great selection of different food types.  Pasta is locally made with an Italian made press.  Great Pizza and nice Burgers for the kids!
Ok
Very nice!
I'm partial to the pizza and resident culture, but this place has options for everyone at every age.
Love this place, good food and some shops. Not very big, so don't expect to spend hours shopping, but that's what I find great about it.
Delicious affordable fun

Stopped in with some friends that are new(ish) to the area and had an excellent time! We got food from Mad Dash and it was SO food - their loaded fries are practically a meal themselves! The atmosphere at this market is always super cool and inviting, I've never had a bad experience!
I wish there were more food options, the place is very clean,  the burger I had could have been seasoned better,  my daughter shrimp po boy was good,  the cashier was nice.

The chicken sandwich had stale bread! I  was afraid to ask for fresher bread because usually small businesses cry about being poor... I just will not go back!! The fries were cold and overcooked.

She was good with her customer service skills.

The pizza place was too expensive for the amount served. I paid $4 extra for baby pepperoni in a personal pizza.

The Mediterranean place served small portions, but the food was good.

The fruit water place was a hit!! IT WAS GREAT!!

Honestly, the place is HiGHLY overrated.
Nice place to hang out anytime and grab some food.
Geno D's pizza is top-notch
Great place to eat with family, and there are lots of choices
Cute! Central location just steps from public transit.  They have plenty of options for everyone but not too many that you'll feel overwhelmed.  Prices are affordable and everything is clean.
Was there for a tour. Very nice little place.

Okay, I am very impressed with the selection availability. Pizza, Dumplings, Burger, Seafood, Soul food, Sweets, Wine, Noodles, Cheese, Smooth, Popcorn or libation, they have it all. Open and airy market concept with seating for a kickback and chill vibe to a quick study sesh or meeting spot. You can't go wrong. Today, I ventured further down the corridor to try a delicious Rose from the Assorted Wine spot, got Momos, and a soft and scrumptious waffle. I usually get my NC catfish fix with Jimmy's and a smoothy. Either way, I feel like I won! Bring a friend, a date orb the family, and see what 7th Street Station is all about!
A lot of food options
Fun chill place to get a variety of different foods and sit down and eat as a group. Neat vibe. I think a ramen place would be a great addition. Will definitely stop by again.
Pretty underwhelming in terms of choices and price. On the day we went, there's only 4-5 shops open.
Nice to Place where you can try out different types of food at one place - Italian, Indian, and American. There is also wine and beer shop and fresh fruit juice to have while you wait for food.
Nice beer spot in here. Haven't tried anything else yet.
This is my third time here in all the food has been great. Service is always exceptional atmosphere.

We tried food at momo station and geno's d pizza. Pan fried chicken momos were appetizing. Steamed chicken momos were succulent and the spicy tomato chutney (sauce) was the game changer, goes superbly with the momos. Chicken kathi rolls were crispy, flaky and filling inside with generous chicken was great.chicken Parmesan pizza was good.
Great place a lot of stalls meny good options
Go to Geno D's Pizza  best in the state.
Went here to try Tase of Soul vegan restaurant. Food was fresh and service was fast and friendly.
Great cider on tap and incredible pasta made fresh at Mano Bella Artisian foods at 7th street. I got the carbonara and could have gone back for 2nds, 3rds! Lol
Very cool place! Variety of options..  think food court in a mall with the sophistication of high-end food and beverages.
Nice and friendly for a afternoon meal before the game at Spectrum Center.
Orrmans Cheese Shop, Not Just Coffee, and Geno D's Pizza are always on the list. Go, enjoy, thank me later.
Lot of food vendors.   You can even have a glass of wine with your lunch/dinner.  Busy place.  Windows looking out looked dirty.
Chill place with great vendors like Gino D's Pizza, Resident Culture Brewery, a wine store, and a cheese store too. Worth checking out.
First time here. Parked 7th station and it was right below. Cool bright energetic vibe. Lots of food and drinks options prior to 4pm, starts to get limited on food after.
Small food courts, few tenants and seem locals like it, not for tourists..

I've been here about 2 times with a friend and always have a good time. This is tucked right beside college st so unless you're really looking for this place, you can easily miss it. It's a small food hall. They have a few good options from chicken, pizza, deli, and a couple of bars and wine spots. They also have some novelty shops there where they sell a lot of Charlotte keepsake. It's always a nice time when I go. We came on a Sunday, and they were surprisingly empty. Just went for a drink. Most of the restaurant shops there were closed so maybe that's why they were empty. None the less, it's def. A must try place. They do have a parking deck right beside the building, and they validate parking, which is a plus. They have clean restrooms, and all employees are super polite. Whenever I'm in the area, this is a place always on my list.
Had a fantastic waffle!

It's a cluster of restaurants where you street food kind. You have a lot of options such as momo stall, pasta stall and burger stalls too. You have coffee bars and cheese shops as well. It had a nice Christmas vibe to it. The pastas looked delicious! You have public parking opposite to this complex.
Lots of really great food.  I enjoyed the cheese shop grilled cheese sandwiches and the pizza.  I have had something from each place and have not been disappointed by any.
Tons of vendors
Ok
Warm and inviting place with many options for a bite to eat and little shops to explore.

Excellent place I wish it was bigger because I didn't want to leave, upbeat ,and chill atmosphere had my 2 girl's 11 and 5 along with my wife had Clam Chowder along with amazing Chicken Curry and Wontons underneath Loaded Fries and Pasta of course everyone ate different things and yes Dad "taste tested" everything for safety Let me say this the Parking situation we paid $14 when you can park next door to this establishment for free 2 hrs than pricing afterwards We weren't informed till after we got inside but hey We relaxed walked the food off a lil came.back to our truck all the better (1 star off because I paid for parking lol) Take your family a chill date take yourself grab a beer some flavored popcorn and the vibe of the place will make it worth it !
Small but nice food court.
This place has great food options! There is seafood, pasta, wine shop, Asian food, waffle place and resident culture brews! Very kid friendly as well.
Great place to eat
Some don't take cash.
Cool spot but I wish there was another couple shops with local stuff. There was a lot of food and drink. It was a nice cafeteria vibe but lacked some shopping
Not worth it at all is called the common market and ppm can't sit without ordering with is ridiculous and think it down right Despicable
Fun, good pizza, cheeses, and wine.

Very fun place to hang out. It has different food options. French place and Italian place are our favorite. Also waffle place and pizza place is amazing too. I feel it is little pricey. But fun place in Charlotte to experience.
Great variety of vendors. Loved the cheese shop.

We visited the market on a Sunday morning, so it wasn't too crowded. It was hard to choose from the great selection of food vendors. I chose the Margherita pizza from Geno D's...delicious! Fresh ingredients and piping hot. I can't wait to visit again.
There is something for everyone! Diverse community!

Great location on the outskirts of the Charlotte business district. This is sort of an indoor festival market, featuring several small businesses in an indoor mall. It includes a nice variety of food vendors, a brewery taproom, and some curio shops. Restrooms available.

I was craving breakfast this morning, so I decided to stop by The Market on 7th St. I ordered the waffle sandwich, made with bacon, egg, and cheese. The waffle is made from scratch. It's so fluffy and light with a hint of sweetness, not too sweet. It pairs perfectly with the layers. It's hot and smells so good. Evert is cooked perfectly with real bacon & and eggs, too. Please try this place if you haven't. They have so many stations that provide so many options. I recommend it. It's definitely on the light rail line, too.
This is a great place to grab a bite, get a drink, enjoy a coffee, and more!  A casual atmosphere and a little something for everyone in the family or group.
Such a nice market with great food!
Fun little area with lots of small businesses! Food, smoothies, drinks, and souvenirs are available inside. Would recommend visiting while in Charlotte!
Love this place! Lots different choices as far as food. Super convenient to the light rail. Check out Jimmy Pearls!

Been going for years since it first opened. Such a vibe... delicious food... lots of options. Another truly wonderful perk is that they validate parking so I never have to stress about parking uptown.

What a great experience! Mano Bella made some exceptional pasta carbonara. Orrman's provided a good charcuterie board. The highlight was the older gentleman working at Assorted Wine. He could not have been more kind and helpful and we had a couple of great 1/2 bottles of wine. Can't wait to go back!
Very nice place
Love the ambience
It was okay.. not missing anything. Optimist hall is better and provides more variety.
Excellent location!!

Only stopped in here because we parked in the parking deck for an adjacent event. Was hungry so we decided to check it out.  Not blown away by anything ... wasn't terrible either, but nothing there made me want to come back
Disappointed.  A few coffee and juice bars, a couple of local restaurants, and a few boutique-type shops.  What was there was good, but very limited selection.
Cool place to visit. Lots of food and beverage options

What a great place. Good idea. Every city should have one of these. Easy parking next to it. The stores inside are fantastic and lovely. A lot of places where to sit. The food is delicious. The staff in the stores is friendly and warm.

Jersey pizza that is to die for (Geno D's Pizza). So many types of delicious cheese (Orrman's Cheese Shop). Fresh pasta and prepared meals to go (mano bella artisan pasta). That's just scratching the surface.

A must stop. Multiple shops from smoothies to gourmet popcorn.  Eateries and hand crafs a lot to choose from. Free samples. We walked thru while waiting for our tour of Charlotte to begin. Has a parking garage validates 90 minutes free.
Neat place to visit for pizza, coffee, cheese, collectibles, souvenirs, waffles under one roof and right next to the public transport rail system
Awesome place to go and hang out!

This cospace of several food and coffee businesses deliveres a very urban atmosphere. There are no chain stores or large businesses present, but rather "Mom&Pop"-type shops.
Everything seems to be cared about and a large amount of thought and effort poured into it. It fits well into it's surroundings.
Would come back!
Great atmosphere. Quick snack or first date type place
There's many places to eat and this was the best restaurant.
This place always have good vibes

Visiting from out of town. We really enjoyed this food mall. We ordered a seafood board, some wine, some Italian food, and a waffle dessert, all in the same place and it was super excellent.  Parking in the attached complex was easy and cheap and most places will validate your parking receipt for a great discount. Will ne returning when in the area again and also recommending it to our friends and family.
The popcorn and the smoothies are amazing
Good food, good atmosphere
So much to eat at the different shops
Really wonderful atmosphere and eclectic vibes. Awesome food and tasty beer!!!
Tons of different food options and a lively atmosphere! Definitely worth a visit.
Loved it...great pizza, great other shops...will be back..
Awesome open market concept I loved all the food that we tried out.
Very quaint but a variety of options.
All the places look good. The food is very good at all the places there.
No still the same nightcaps
Wonderful experience l
It's a great place
Excellent food and shopping
Quiet for a Monday. Don't forget to get your parking stub endorsement with your purchase. It saves!
This was super cute. Local area eats and businesses, tables to sit, and a nice little to do if you live or work in that are.
Really cool vibe with a lot of options

This is a great spot for a variety of different foods, snacks, desserts, smoothies, coffee etc. There is a wine business,  gourmet cheese spot, & a shop selling different items. This is a place you'll need to visit a few times in order to taste every restaurant.
I order from Mad Dash the Mad Dash Angus Burger w/ lettuce, tomato,  cheese, friend egg, & aioli sauce. It was really good however my top bioche bun was toasted a little too long so it wasn't soft. Order the onion rings which were so good I didn't need ketchup. The 8 lemon peppered wings with their homemade ranch was really good too. They were different & better from the wings you'd get at a Buffalo Wild Wings or East Coast Wings.
Jimmy Pearl's Sorrel Punch is tasty. The shrimp, greens, fried fish & fish sandwich are good too! Staff is friendly.
Hip Hop Smoothie is different from what I've seen before and I was pleasantly surprised. The owner is friendly and helped me figure out what I might like since I'm not a smoothie drinker.
This was my second visit.. the first visit I was in food heaven & order from about 4 places.  However, I've got to go back a few more times so I can try EV-ER-Y-THING!  There are tables in the center of the floor for seating & some seating in front of the actual food spots. Oh, located next to ImaginOn, the rail & 7th street parking garage. Any of the businesses can validate your parking ticket which covers the first hour & a half.
Popcorn lady is THE BEST!!!!!!!
Good fast lunch

Small market place with a few vendors that I wasn't able to check out. I thought the place was much bigger to explore and was sadly disappointed when I walked in and everything was right there! Just a square with some vendors and some tables.
Fantastic! My favorite spots were Hip Hop Smoothies and It's Poppin Kettle Korn !
The vibe and variety of food snack options are amazing here.

Good
.
Not as expected

Nice and simple food market with just enough options near Uptown and right off the line. Orrman's is the draw for us here, but I'm glad we sat and drank from Assorted right next to them. Not too busy, and very chill hang out on a rainy MDW. We'll be back for some pasta.
Nice market, only a few vendors are open on Mondays.
Had dinner here with some friends before a show and got a bottle of wine at the wine store to share--the man running the store was so nice and helpful!! Would recommend 10/10
I love this place but the outside has a few undesirables

Stumbled on this gem while at the discovery place a lot
Of great unique shops and food. Go every time I go downtown!

Fun, locally oriented market-style food court  and retail area. You can drink wine, walk around, and chat with local business owners. We even stumbled upon a public tango class and had a delicious spontaneous raclette dinner!
Yummy foods! Hip Hop Smoothies is located here!
This place is so cool! So many different vendors with amazing food and unique gifts! The whole place is a great vibe!
Super cute place with a great local artist shop.
All food vendors closed on mondays.

Very popular on a rainy Friday. Families and friends meeting. A little pricey, $3.50 for REGULAR coffee, but that's Uptown Charlotte. A few speciatly restaurants, coffee, waffles, noodles, pizza, cheese, wine and more, even handmade craft shop. Enjoy.peace
Loved this place. It was a great stop with yummy food, wine, and treats. Although it was small it was perfect for a lunch with friends. Nice shops and and employees throughout the entire location.
Went on a Monday for lunch and almost everything was closed. Try a different day of the week.
Great food. Excellent service. Will definitely go again, and choose from their wide selection.
Great selection of foods and drinks. Fun crowd
Caminando por Charlotte me gusto comer en este Market con diferentes opciones
Terrible place very rude horrible attitude.... no southern hospitality here
It's a cute smaller place. More geared for food and drinks.
Great food !
Really fun spot to hang with some friends and also some good diverse food, only wish it had more sitting area especially with how busy it gets
I purchased a delicious Cuban sandwich from there.  It was cooked to perfection.
Good food. Several options.
A ton of good stuff here! But Geno D's is the treasure. MUST HAVE PIZZA!
Historic!!

I love the vendors, they're all great. Can't say enough good things about Geno D's. But the parking here is ridiculous. $3 for the first 20mins and half the collection machines are broken. I would go here twice as much if they didn't charge for in and out parking.

What an enjoyable Sunday we spent as a Family together (we are from Puerto Rico and South Africa) @ The Market
Friendly Service/Great Wine & Food & Cappuccino/Great Smelling Restrooms - Definitely worth a Visit
Best coffee in town. First 1:30 hours free parking.
